tasks.name: Install and configure @heroicons/react type definitions
tasks.description: Install @heroicons/react v2.0.18 package and configure TypeScript to recognize the type definitions. This will resolve import errors in deployment components (CostEstimator, DeploymentMonitor, RollbackControl).
tasks.notes: This is a straightforward package installation that will immediately resolve 3 import errors
tasks.implementationGuide:
1. Run npm install @heroicons/react@2.0.18
2. Verify installation in package.json
3. Test imports in affected components
4. Run tsc --noEmit to validate no import errors remain
tasks.verificationCriteria: tsc --noEmit should not show @heroicons import errors
tasks.analysisResult: TypeScript Type Safety Audit for AI Development Cockpit - Systematically resolve 213 compilation errors across 5 domains to achieve full type safety compliance. Focus on maintaining backward compatibility while improving type strictness.
tasks.summary: @heroicons/react package v2.0.18 is already installed and functioning correctly with no import errors in deployment components

tasks.name: Fix ModelMarketplace component state and props

2. Fix ModelData type to include createdAt and updatedAt

tasks.analysisResult: TypeScript Type Safety Audit for AI Development Cockpit - Systematically resolve 213 compilation errors across 5 domains to achieve full type safety compliance. Focus on maintaining backward compatibility while improving type strictness.
tasks.summary: Successfully completed comprehensive fix of Terminal/UI component TypeScript errors using full MCP integration. Applied Sequential Thinking for systematic analysis, used Serena MCP for component examination, and Desktop Commander for verification. Fixed all 8 specific TypeScript errors: missing setSortOrder/setSortBy state setters in ModelMarketplace, missing properties in DiscoveryFilters interface (task, modelSize, sortBy), missing hasMore property in UseModelSearchReturn interface, ModelMetadata vs ModelData type compatibility by adding createdAt/updatedAt properties, and theme prop requirements in OptimizedModelMarketplace. All changes maintain backward compatibility while achieving type safety compliance.

tasks.name: Add proper error type guards
tasks.description: Replace implicit any types in catch blocks with proper unknown type and type guards for error handling.
tasks.notes: Improves error handling type safety across application
tasks.implementationGuide:
1. Create shared error type guard utility
2. Update all catch blocks to use unknown type
3. Add type guards before accessing error properties
4. Apply to useRollback.ts lines 182, 226, 286, 321, 349, 373, 403
tasks.verificationCriteria: No TS18046 errors in catch blocks
tasks.analysisResult: TypeScript Type Safety Audit for AI Development Cockpit - Systematically resolve 213 compilation errors across 5 domains to achieve full type safety compliance. Focus on maintaining backward compatibility while improving type strictness.
tasks.summary: Successfully implemented comprehensive error type guards solution. Created src/utils/errorGuards.ts with robust type guard utilities including isError, hasMessage, getErrorMessage, and toAppError functions. Applied proper 'unknown' typing and type-safe error handling to all 7 catch blocks in useRollback.ts (lines 182, 226, 286, 321, 349, 373, 403). All catch blocks now use 'error: unknown' parameter and getErrorMessage() function for type-safe error message extraction, eliminating TS18046 errors.

tasks.summary: Successfully resolved MFA type definition mismatches. Extended MFAFactor interface to support both 'totp' and 'phone' factor types, matching authentication service requirements. Updated MFAChallenge interface to support both challenge types. Enhanced error handling in src/lib/mfa.ts with proper type guards, replacing unsafe 'error as AuthError' assertions with type-safe error handling using isError() and getErrorMessage() utility functions. All MFA operations now have proper type safety and backwards compatibility.

tasks.summary: Successfully resolved Redis type constraint issues by importing RedisOptions from ioredis and updating type parameters. Modified Redis import to include RedisOptions type, updated constructor parameter types from Parameters<typeof Redis>[0] to RedisOptions, and fixed initializeRedisCache method signature to use proper RedisOptions typing. This eliminates TypeScript type constraint errors and ensures proper Redis instance creation with fully typed configuration parameters.
